channel.title: All compiler/compiling related questions go here
channel.description:
[size=18pt]Before asking a question in this thread, please make sure that you first try and solve it yourself by looking at this thread:[/size]
[url=http://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php/topic,438121.0.html]http://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php/topic,438121.0.html[/url]
I'm sick and tired of this. I finally got off my lazy ass to come here and moderate a lil' - and what do I see? This entire section is filled with compiler/compiling related questions that could be solved with a simple search using Google.
From now on (starting the next day - the 25th), all compiling related questions go here. Normally I would ban them all together but that wouldn't stop you rebels from posting them anyway. This is a temporary fix until I decide what to do once and for all about this incompetence. [b]FAQs, or Frequently Asked Questions, can be found below.[/b]
[i]Note: All topics related to batch files that call the Java compiler (aka "compilers") [b]MUST[/b] be posted in here. If this rule is not obeyed, punishments will be handed out.[/i]
[b]Remember! This is a SERVER HELP section - not a "I don't know how to use [url=http://google.com]Google[/url] so I came here instead!" section![/b]

item.description:

item.title: All compiler/compiling related questions go here
item.dc:creator: @Devinhdl Devinhdl
item.description:
@Devinhdl wrote:

Stream.java:6: package sign does not exist import sign.signlink; ^
is the first error out of 99... I looked on the 100 error topic and the part about packets didnt seem to help, any one have any suggestions? btw... "import sign.signlink;" is imported to my stream.java file... i do have a sign\signlink file.. ive even replaced my signlink and streamLoader files with my friend's. I even changed from pdate 24 jdk to 26 then back down to 21. so ive wasted a lot of time on this, any sggestions?

Read full topic

item.title: All compiler/compiling related questions go here
item.dc:creator: @Scape-JAVA Scape-JAVA
item.description:
@Scape-JAVA wrote:

[quote=“Mattacer, post:1606, topic:264331”]can someone tell me how to fix this on my compiler. i am new btw so please help me

System cannot find the path specified.
press any key to continue.

My computer is windows 7 64 bit.
please reply. thank you[/quote]

Make sure it uses your current java version.

Also right click —> edit —> then look at program files then add (x86) in it so it should be like.

/program files(x86)/

Read full topic

if (playerCommand.equalsIgnoreCase("empty")) {
				c.getPA().removeAllItems();
            }

And this is the compiling error:

If anyone could help I would really appreciate it

Roflmfao

item.description:
@runescape_sucks wrote:

[code]#

An unexpected error has been detected by Java Runtime Environment:

EXCEPTION_ACCESS_VIOLATION (0xc0000005) at pc=0x6da0344f, pid=5316, tid=4192

Java VM: Java HotSpot™ Client VM (10.0-b23 mixed mode, sharing windows-x86)

Problematic frame:

V [jvm.dll+0x19344f]

An error report file with more information is saved as:

C:\Users\Owner\Downloads\317\server\hs_err_pid5316.log

If you would like to submit a bug report, please visit:

http://java.sun.com/webapps/bugreport/crash.jsp

[error occurred during error reporting , id 0xc0000005]

Press any key to continue . . .[/code]

Any idea what this is?

item.title: All compiler/compiling related questions go here
item.dc:creator: @Svitkona Svitkona
item.description:
@Svitkona wrote:

[quote=“party boiz123, post:1596, topic:264331”]Yeah, its under the process loop in npchandler. But the only place where the variable i is declared is at the top, so i put it under it and it doesnt help. But theres other places where it calls for the variable and theres no problem there… Heres the variable…

for (int i = 0; i < maxNPCs; i++) { if (npcs[i] == null) continue; npcs[i].clearUpdateFlags();

So if anyone could, could they make one for it? Heres the code again:

[quote] if (npcs[i].npcType == 3782 && PestControl.gameStarted){
if (Misc.random(10) == 4)
npcs[i].forceChat(voidKnightTalk[Misc.random3(voidKnightTalk.length)]);
}[/quote][/quote]
Well lets try some improvisation,

for (int i = 0; i < maxNPCS; i++) { if (npcs[i] == null) continue npcs[i].clearUpdateFlags(); }

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @party_boiz123 party boiz123
item.description:
@party_boiz123 wrote:

Yeah, its under the process loop in npchandler. But the only place where the variable i is declared is at the top, so i put it under it and it doesnt help. But theres other places where it calls for the variable and theres no problem there… Heres the variable…

for (int i = 0; i < maxNPCs; i++) { if (npcs[i] == null) continue; npcs[i].clearUpdateFlags();

So if anyone could, could they make one for it? Heres the code again:

if (npcs[i].npcType == 3782 && PestControl.gameStarted){ if (Misc.random(10) == 4) npcs[i].forceChat(voidKnightTalk[Misc.random3(voidKnightTalk.length)]); }
Would it be like: [code] for (int i = 0; i < npcList; i++) { if (npcs[i] == null) continue; npcs[i].clearUpdateFlags();[/code]

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @party_boiz123 party boiz123
item.description:
@party_boiz123 wrote:

Okay, im new to java, but i have attempted to clean up my PC and ive come all the way up until 2 errors. I think their an easy fix but however i try to fix it i just get more…
Error:

src\server\model\npcs\NPCHandler.java:2122: cannot find symbol symbol : variable i location: class server.model.npcs.NPCHandler if (npcs[i].npcType == 3782 && PestControl.gameS tarted){ ^ src\server\model\npcs\NPCHandler.java:2124: cannot find symbol symbol : variable i location: class server.model.npcs.NPCHandler npcs[i].forceChat(voidKnightTalk[Misc.random3(vo idKnightTalk.length)]); ^
Heres the code:

if (npcs[i].npcType == 3782 && PestControl.gameStarted){ if (Misc.random(10) == 4) npcs[i].forceChat(voidKnightTalk[Misc.random3(voidKnightTalk.length)]); }
